extendedIngredients.name: arugula leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 4. Stir the arugula leaves into the garbanzo bean-tomato mixture, taste and adjust seasoning. Mound the salad in the center of a platter and arrange the prawns around the salad. Serve immediately.

title: Grilled Spot Prawns With Garbanzo Beans, Tomatoes And Arugula
summary: Grilled Spot Prawns With Garbanzo Beans, Tomatoes And Arugula might be just the main course you are searching for. This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe serves 15 and costs $2.15 per serving. One serving contains 280 calories, 22g of protein, and 10g of fat. A mixture of olive oil, torn arugula leaves, salt, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the ground cumin you could follow this main course with the Moroccan Chocolate Mousse as a dessert. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 14 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 66%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes include Grilled Spot Prawns, Grilled Prawns (Shrimp) With Rocket (Arugula) and Campari Tomatoes, and California Spot Prawns with Thai Seasoning.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.
